result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger A Zimmerman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Atty Cuevas requested case be set for an argued plea/sentencing hearing in approximately 60 days; Court granted request but advised Atty Cuevas a date would also be scheduled for trial

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:47
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
